reviews.text: A very important landmark in Basel with rich European religious, social and political history. The external and internal architecture are amazing. The stained glass windows are spectacular in colour and details. The reverent atmosphere, the tall ceilings and many details speak volumes of a time now gone in religious devotion. The view of the City of Basel and the Rhein from the highest point of the tower, which can be reached climbing three sets of stairs, is absolutely fantastic. The Basel Cathedral is definitely a must when visiting Basel.

The most prominent church of Basel. You can go up the spire by paying 2 or 3 CHF per person and enjoy stunning views of the city. You can buy souvenirs at the ground floor shop. Quite spacious inside and lot of open spaces around it.

A Beautiful Old Cathedral. You can actually climb to the top of the towers and have a view and the art inside is stunning, and right in front of the church is an open area to just chill, if nothing is present at the time.
A beautiful old church, where you can walk up to the tower. A small spiral staircase to the top. Excellent for everyone. The views of the city and mountains are amazing.
Beautiful. Has a museum shop inside and the towers are (during warm and dry weather) mostly open for tourists. Definitely worth visiting.
Absolutely, the most beautiful part of Basel! Full of  visible historical landmarks and quirky shops (like Johann Wanner Christmas shop), cafes and restaurants.  Picture perfect!!
A Beautiful Structure build. Very old. I went with my classmates there!
Its a big gate tower, impressive, in really good condition take a photo off you go

Supposed to be a three star Hotel, but seemed more like a 4 star. Could only imagine how nice a 5 star hotel in Basel is. Beautiful hotel and close to historical district. Amazing staff. Would recommend to anyone visiting Basel, Switzerland.

The Spalentor is the end of my favourite street in Basel. I reccomend that you walk from the Universität to here through the beautiful street leading to it. The Spalentor itself is very pretty and one of the remnants of the very old part of the town. I take all my visitors there and recommend to walk by it if you can.

The building and grounds are beautiful. The galleries are spacious and very well lit with vast floor to ceiling windows adding to the views of the art and country side. Visited during the Picasso Blue Rose period plus the museum's own collection of later Picassos. Overall an impressive exhibit with several works on loan from private parties and museums from around the world.
Fantastic museum. Went whilst the Picasso the younger years exhibition was showing. Very well done and I hear the main collection is lovely too. Worth a visit if you like art.

reviews.author_name: The Law Office of Dr Curtis FJ Doebbler
reviews.text: Reasonably good collection. Impressed by blue and red period retrospective of Picasso's work, but explanations not very detailed considering Beyeler apparently knew Picasso. Still very much worth the visit. Nice basement cafe,but price gouges clients seeking coffee, for which local cafes provide much better value for money and have better coffee.

I went there for the Gaugin exhibition last year and the Picasso show yesterday.
When I attended the exhibition last year I was told that my camera was "too professional". I simply removed the flash and that was okay to allow me access with my camera!

Yesterday, they wouldn't again allow me to enter with compact camera I was carrying but my Mobile phone (with higher resolution) was allowed.

The gallery is airy and bright. Lots of space and places to sit and simply look.

The restaurant is classically elegant and the prices a bit steep but worth it as a once in a while treat.
The Picasso exhibition was excellent. We used audio guides for further insight. The late afternoon sun in the building and gardens gives the whole place a  special feeling.
Visited the exciting Bruce Naumann exhibition. A must see, especially when you are curious about video art developed over time and how this artist challenged himself and his occupation.

Great museum with really nice exhibition.
The building alone is worth a visit.
Highly recommended, if you like cutting edge contemporary art.
One of few amazing institutions/museums in Basel. Must see. From the architecture of the building to the permanent art collection.
Stunning expirience !
This museum is a wonderful experience.  Well thought out displays.  Each floor exploring a cultural concept.  The staff were excellent. The museum cafe is an added bonus.
Very interesting exhibitions. The visit to this museum is a wonderful experience.
One of my favorite museums in Basel. The building itself has fascinating architecture, especially from the outside. Staff was friendly. It had some interactive stuff to do.
Exhibition is not very interesting for kids (nothing to touch, nothing interactive). Staff very unfriendly and not understanding of parents.

Personally was more impressed with the old museum when it was still connected with the Natural History Museum. The new building and exhibitions are very interesting, but somehow certain parts feel a bit like an art museum.

Really, nice place for older children. Youngest one will get bored.
Be aware that you can't leave the building and came back on the same ticket. In the UK in the most of the cases you can easily leave and come back on the same ticket. In my case I had to leave eat something as my kids felt hungry

This was a really fun museum! There were so many detailed and intricate displays to look at! Many included Teddy bears, but there were other things too - hats, dolls, carnival and fair scenes.... I highly recommend a visit to this museum is you're in Basel :)

The toy museum is a collection of old toys, puppets and teddy bears that is spread over 4 floors. One floor also shows a variety of extraordinary hats, some of them can even  be tried in for a fun picture. The different items are arranged in various ways like in houses, on a car racing track and so on. What I would have liked is to read more about the items at the place they were displayed, because there were little guides available in the certain rooms, yet not for everyone and it would have been more comfortable the other way. Yet the experience was interesting to see since some of the toys already looked very old but still in good shape. It is a fun place to bring your kids too.

In the stuffed animal exhibition, I could have easily cried as it was like stepping directly into the eyes and imagination of my childhood. The whimsical window displays with Steiff animals deeply touch my normally cold exterior and bring a lot of joy to the city of Basel. Well done to the lovely team who has put this wonderful place together.

Not sure about the place. I came on my own half an hour before closing time and i was just by myself in the whole museum. ITS CREEEPYYYY!!! Maybe im not used to see so many toys but i just felt im in some horror movie. Wouldn’t take my child here :)

Interesting show room/gallery /museum. Has a very nice restaurant, where you "test" one style of the chairs that are sold there as well. Can be visited with children as they have an area where they can play.

It feels like all modern design traces it's roots to 20th century industrial design, and this place is a shrine. You night not know the names but you'll still recognize the pieces, and you will know many of the architects who have contributed to the space. At the very least the main building is a lustworthy assemblage of Vitra's catalogue, and institution m inspiration for how to spend a lottery winnings.
Cool place to hang out. The food was delicious, gift shop has unique things to purchase at reasonable prices, and my children loved the slide.

It is the best museum to admire and try on exceptional designers' chairs. A very family friendly museum with lots of open space and a great slide for kids. It is indeed a showcase compound for the few renowned
The museum features design related exhibits, an architecture tour, a chair museum and the furniture gallery. If you like mid century modem design, you'll thoroughly enjoy visiting.

Visiting from the UK for the weekend, my friend and I visited Basel Zoo on a Saturday morning. The staff were friendly, the exhibits were many, and the animals looked happy. There was also one occasion where a member of staff had to swap from Deutsch to English to help me out; I appreciated that a lot! My only issue were a few areas that appeared unclean, such as the fish tanks in the aquarium. Thank you for making our trip more enjoyable!
It was great. Zoo have vast species across the world. Excellent place to reconnect with nature
Excellent experience for families. Kids really enjoy it and the variety of animals is impressive. Restaurant is also ok. Parking is very limited and expensive.

I just visited this lovely zoo. It was a cold day but was able to see almost all of the animals. I’ve been to many zoos in the USA from NY to California and I would rank this one up there . It is small but well done. I have never seen a Snow leopard until today! I would recommend this zoo. Only issue I saw was on the signs for the animal info there wasn’t a translation in English but I wouldn’t take a star away for that.

This zoo is diverse, not the best I have been to, but good enough. There are many animals you can see here. Well organized and very clean. 

I suggest you to visit it in summer since in winter many animals are inside and it makes the zoo looks a bit empty from the outside.
Harıka
The loveliest and simple punk rock food experience you can have. Casual, with lots of heart.
They have some of the best concerts in town. Definitely worth checking out
great gay friendly punk cafe !!
Great place. Very casual, friendly atmosphere.
Good food, better environment :) y

Classic Swiss/German atmosphere and food. 
A place where local people gather for good food and drinks. Not a tourist trap. Love the “pretzel tree” they give you! (Instead of a basket of rolls). Would love to come back here!

The restaurant is located in a very beautiful place near a tram station, with a lot of squares and other shops. The welcome was great, they have very nice personnel and well intended. We received a place even the restaurant was almost full. The food was delicious and served fast. The meat well done and the portions are big. The menu is not that diverse but but you can find something to fit your taste. The atmosphere is nice, Swiss like whit a bit of a crowdy noise but not disturbing. The prices are medium for Switzerland. Enjoy
Great traditional Swiss food, great beer. A simple, good, place to eat and have a drink. You'll most likely have to share a table, but that's exactly what you would expect from this kind of place.

Great beer, food also looks good. Got the impression that mostly locals eat there, and that is always a good recommendation.
Good atmosphere.

This place is great for families with kids because it's pretty loud and there are fun, decorated bears everywhere.  We have always had great experiences with the staff, and the food is pretty decent, too!
QUIET simple great place for after work Spero, you can talk with no background noise

Always dingey and dark with very odd opening hours.

Meh!
Great restaurant
Traditional fantastic service
Great atmosphere

We were difficult and noisy customers (14 people) but the service as IMPECCABLE! They always smiled and were super helpful!  The food was delicious and fresh, desserts were to die for! Would totally go back and recommend it!!

Chez Donati is a well known address in Basel - we had dinner on a Saturday night during Baselworld: the place was crowded and there was a limited menu due to the fair.
First of all the staff was very friendly and kept smiling even though they were very busy and running around to please the guests..
We arrived at the restaurant at 6.30pm and were waiting 1.5hrs for the starters to be served - which was definitely too long.
The food was very nice but not super exciting - in my opinion overpriced to comparable Italian restaurants.. we asked the waiter 2 questions that he wanted to check on and get back to us but... he just never did - it was a bit awkward. 
Anyhow, we take it that it was all due to Baselworld, the place being fully booked and the staff being overwhelmed. I have heard from others that it usually is a different experience, so I will give it another try one day.
Delicious Italian menu in a very nice location, good for business meetings!
Delicious food here followed up with a sumptuous dessert trolley
Absolutely beautiful restaurant with excellent food service and view

Engineered and pretentious. The tastes are right but too many and all of the same texture makes it boring in my opinion. The lunch appeared to me more of a demonstration of a good student with a collection of aroma than an actual reflection on a real meal. Additionally, service was average with 2 false information (raw or cooked fish, vegetarian or not) from the waiter.

We had a fantastic dinner here. The service was perfectly attentive and friendly, and the place had a lovely ambience. Each course was spectacular - with the carrot salad in particular involving some sort of magic and the basil sorbet a sheer delight. The bill was not cheap, but we ate in a number of restaurants around central Basel and overall it compares pretty well. It's a really lovely place to go for dinner and/or drinks. Thanks!
A real tasting esperience. Surprising dishes, very interesting wine pairing and wonderful service.
Best meals ever! Service was excellent!
Their lunch menu was well balanced and had a very special touch to it. The staff was attentive and very knowledgeable
Top top professional service, beautiful atmosphere and delicious hearty food. Highly recommended!

Der Birseckerhof ist eine Erinnerung aus meiner Kindheit!..
Mein letzter Besuch ist wohl unglaubliche 30 Jahre her!!! Von innen sieht es aber immer noch wie früher aus.
Das Abendessen, der Service sowie der Wein waren ausgezeichnet. Die Portionen sind sehr grosszügig u. zum Schluss gab es noch je ein Grappa zum Dank.
Wir werden sehr bald wieder kommen. Ich kann den Birseckerhof nur jedem empfehlen.
Sehr gutes Restaurant zum essen, etwas im älteren Stil eingerichtet, aber doch sehr schön. Sehr freundliches Personal!
Sehr freundliche Bedienung, einfaches, sehr gutes Essen, Preise anständig.
Super gutes Essen und sehr freundliche Bedienung!
Nice Asian CH chain.  Good food, clean. Good service
Very good food and kind service

Simple, this place never fails to deliver and its great to be able to Swing backwards and forwards in your seat as you eat - Try it!! Its like being a child at a park! Beijing nights (Sweet and Sour Chicken) and rice is to die for and also their Pad Thai and fried rice. They also did like a Fried Chicken and fries which was like a KFC ,but obviously not KFC, but tasted better! :-D

I ordered online take away and when my husband got there they told us no order has been placed. Even though I received a confirmation. He was then quite left alone and had to ask a few times before they handled the matter.  Eventually, after 45min waiting, he finally got the food and still had to make his way home. I hoped at least the food was worth the waiting and the hastle, but the Vietnamese food was not authentic, you could smell that it was just beef-cube, and the noodles were still hard. I had to cook them again until they were edible... what if I were somewhere out?? what a pitty... would not order again.

This is our first visit since their upgrade. Great new menus, including the menu from their sister restaurant chain, Negishi and a drink menu with clever non-alcoholic options. We are certain to make this a regular haunt.

The staff are very nice, fast service, well curated menus: All would be perfect except for one thing. This may not bother some people, but it did concern me. If you need to use silverware, you have to take it out of a utensil bucket on the table. The spoons and forks are facing business end up. This means that when somebody pulls one out, the utensils next to them are being touched as well. Unless you just use chopsticks or order a large soup that comes with a spoon, you may be putting your mouth where a stranger put their hand :-(

Only some people would be bothered by this, but I really think they need to change how silverware is provisioned.

Other than that, the reinvented Nooch @ Barfi is a hard place to beat for Asian food in Basel.

Not sure what happened to this restaurant. But it dropped a lot. New cook and service team feel just average. You can see the lack of motivation. A petty.

We enjoyed the great, warm summer evening. But food was average. And the menus are simple, so not hard to prepare well.

Would we go again? No. Now we understand why the other places nearby where sold-out a few days in advance. The good things sell first.

Pricy, but very good. I had the steak (medium) which was cooked to perfection. The port sauce that came with it was amazing. My husband had the veal and that was delicious as well. We sat outside and enjoyed the views while dining.

Ice cream was decent and coffee was ok. A bit pricey for its level.
Seems more luxurious than the actual experience you get.
Nice place to relax.
Lovely food beautiful location
Nice service and nice location

We were difficult and noisy customers (14 people) but the service as IMPECCABLE! They always smiled and were super helpful!  The food was delicious and fresh, desserts were to die for! Would totally go back and recommend it!!

Chez Donati is a well known address in Basel - we had dinner on a Saturday night during Baselworld: the place was crowded and there was a limited menu due to the fair.
First of all the staff was very friendly and kept smiling even though they were very busy and running around to please the guests..
We arrived at the restaurant at 6.30pm and were waiting 1.5hrs for the starters to be served - which was definitely too long.
The food was very nice but not super exciting - in my opinion overpriced to comparable Italian restaurants.. we asked the waiter 2 questions that he wanted to check on and get back to us but... he just never did - it was a bit awkward. 
Anyhow, we take it that it was all due to Baselworld, the place being fully booked and the staff being overwhelmed. I have heard from others that it usually is a different experience, so I will give it another try one day.
Delicious Italian menu in a very nice location, good for business meetings!
Delicious food here followed up with a sumptuous dessert trolley
Absolutely beautiful restaurant with excellent food service and view

Engineered and pretentious. The tastes are right but too many and all of the same texture makes it boring in my opinion. The lunch appeared to me more of a demonstration of a good student with a collection of aroma than an actual reflection on a real meal. Additionally, service was average with 2 false information (raw or cooked fish, vegetarian or not) from the waiter.

We had a fantastic dinner here. The service was perfectly attentive and friendly, and the place had a lovely ambience. Each course was spectacular - with the carrot salad in particular involving some sort of magic and the basil sorbet a sheer delight. The bill was not cheap, but we ate in a number of restaurants around central Basel and overall it compares pretty well. It's a really lovely place to go for dinner and/or drinks. Thanks!
A real tasting esperience. Surprising dishes, very interesting wine pairing and wonderful service.
Best meals ever! Service was excellent!
Their lunch menu was well balanced and had a very special touch to it. The staff was attentive and very knowledgeable
